items.name: Bard's Cape
items.wikiNote: Drop info missing, needs error checking
items.wikiFreeText:
=Acquisition=
The devs gave this cape to some of the lucky players, as thanks for their successful contribution of quest texts. The quest texts were eventually used in the game.

These lucky players were greeted with the following message in their ChatWarsBot.
 Tonight is the night. This night you were blessed by the gods. They decided to come down and gift you, PlayerName, with a cheese basket. The catch is, this basket is not made out of cheese and it's not even a basket.
  
 Right now it includes:
 :Present: Assistant box x 1
 Bard's Cape x 1

items.name: Blessed Cloak
items.description: A cloak designed to give praise to the Dev Gods, it features gems outlining the edges of the orange and yellow fabric, representing fire. In the center is their class, requesting a prayer to buff their stats, but nerf the class they dislike the most. Some users sew designs of hammers, silouettes of girls, meat, or foam darts into the free space.
items.freeText: It was introduced with the [[Game updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].

items.name: Champion Sword
items.description: A sword with high honors, it has a mithril core with an edge made of ruby. The outer metal holster has a brilliant silver sheen, outlined by the red of the cutting edge. About 4 feet long, the daunting blade is considered a longsword. With a pure gold crossguard and hilt, wrapped in a thick red twine, its envied by duelists and show-offs

Chocolate is a consumable item that gives the player one :Stamina: stamina, but not increasing the maximum amount of stamina.

items.description: An experimental blend of plants burned to ash, tree resin, intense thermal chilling, and wood dust, the result is a natural weapon made from nature. items.name: Doomblade Sword
items.wikiNote: needs sale price, weight and wrapping added
items.freeText:
It was introduced with the [[Game_updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].
 The Doomblade Sword gets its name due to the way its manufactured. A steel blade is forged with coke, to give it a black color. After cooling, acid is applied to the blade, coloring and hardening the metal through chemistry. The case hardened finish is a mix of a dark gold, light blue, red and brown, all the way down the black blade.

items.name: Doomblade Sword recipe
items.freeText: It was introduced in the [[Game updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].

items.name: Dragon Mace
items.description: Breaking the norm, the Dragon Mace is decorated with teeth like spikes, mounted on a solid, fist sized orb. Each spike is curled slightly, giving a gnarled, rough appearance to the weapon. The shaft, only about a foot long, is decorated in a dragon like design, which wraps around the handle and curls off the grip in a tail like shape.

items.description: Designed by castle leaders and war generals, the Hailstorm Bow was taken from the idea of a blizzard. Capable of using Steel Arrows, arrows are polished until glistening, and shot in a snowstorm like hail of arrows. The bow itself is a wrap of milkstone and a mithril base, providing more power and flexibility than the tier below it.

items.name: Hunter Bow
items.description: Much like the matching armor, the Hunter Bow aims for lightweight use. Mithril is forged with iron internals, to allow more flexibility rather than having a solid piece of metal bend, and roped off with a thicker piece of metal twine. Being too strong for Wooden Arrows, Steel Arrows are recommended for use.

items.name: Hunter dagger
items.wikiNote: needs weight, sale price & wrapping added
items.freeText:
It was added to the game with the April 3, 2018 update.

 Taking motivation from the chestpiece of the same set, the mithril blade is more advanced than the castle shop's dagger. Shaped like a kitchen knife, one side has a blade, while the other side is a ripple of serrated, thick, bent teeth. Exceeding in stabbing, slashing, hacking and even sawing, the Hunter Dagger takes those off guard with ease.

items.name: Imperial Axe
items.description: A standard Steel Axe, except for the ruby edge. The blade end has been flattened and replaced with a ruby edge. Having two sides of flat steel, it allows the user to have some creativity. Whether its a vine, forest scenery, or their own castle, each axe is a weapon up the sleeve of anyone willing to wield it.

items.name: King's Defender
items.description: The King's Defender is a tribute to the castle of which it was made. The metal, dyed and mixed with natural elements during forging, is left in castle complementary colors, and smithed with the honors of castle leadership. Recognizeable by the colors, its also customized by the warriors of each castle in any prideful way they seem fit. Cheers!

items.name: Leather
items.freeText: Half of a leather hide folded over, cut down the middle and sewn at the chin, a simple cowl is produced. Brown and color and thin, it drapes over the sides of your head and covers your neck. With the benefit of being waterproof and light weight, its great for disguising or concealing your identity.

items.name: Lightning Bow
items.description: Perhaps the fastest firing bow for its tier, it's nicknamed lightning respectively. Cleanly releasing energy on firing, and able to be drawn back 25% further than the Composite or Hailstorm bow, it prides itself in being able to punch through most armors. Featuring a 'tier' like design, the ripples help conserve energy in the frame.

It can also be crafted with [[Crafting (Skill)]] 3 or higher; available to [[Blacksmith|blacksmiths]] or other players through [[Master Shop|blacksmith's shops]]. items.freeText: It was introduced to the game with the [[Valentines Day 2018]] event and was removed with the end of the event. It was one of the ingredients needed to craft [[Cake|cakes]].

items.name: Mithril dagger
items.freeText: Top of the line for daggers found in the shop, the Catalina Blue knife is sharp as a razor, and durable enough to be hammered and bent at will. With an edge hard enough to scratch mid-grade quality steel, many warriors cherish the blade. Some models even feature a loop, capable of being strapped to a user's wrist to prevent being lost in combat.

items.name: Mithril shield
items.description: The dark blue metal of this shield is a show to the strength of Mithril. Adopting a tower like design, and a kite shape, it rests on the floor and reaches the user's chin. The oversized shield is effective in protecting the user's full body, and even enables some offense by bashing or charging a foe.
items.freeText: Unlike other [[Weapon|weapons]] the {{PAGENAME}} is listed under ''Equipment'' in the [[Shop|shop]] and not weapons, but it uses the [[Weapon|Off Hand Weapon]] slot to be equipped, as all other [[Weapon|weapons]] do.

items.name: Nightfall Bow

items.name: Order Armor
items.description: A heavyset piece of armor with a brass like tinge, its easily compared to dwarven ingot. Decorated with glory filled eagles, intricate designs of swirls and vines, and 3 sapphires on the chest, this heavy armor is top of the line for any brute that would like to hold the line and defend their castle.

items.name: Order Shield
items.description: The handcrafted shield features an emblazoned emblem of your castle's symbol in gold thread, inserted into the small depths of an etching. The gold twinkles out from the bronze like overlay of the shield, triangle in shape. It sharply bends downwards, and raises in the corners to provide a wide area of protection for the castle defenders.

items.name: Rapier
items.wikiFreeText:
==Flavor text==
 Silver is wrapped over an iron core to give a neat appearance but strength for heavy duty use. About 4 foot long and thin, the sword is popular for half-swording, where the blade is gripped to increase control, and used like a knife. The blade is as popular for combat as it is for sport, where some dulled down swords are used in fencing.

The :Bookgreen: {{PAGENAME}} is a scroll that is used to [[Enchantment|enchant]] Tier 2 :Bookgreen: [[Equipment|equipment]] of the type [[Protective Gear|protective gear]] as well as all Tier 2 :Bookgreen: [[Shield|shields]].

This scroll is used to enchant items of the Tier 2 :Bookgreen: quality. Enchanting an item with :Bookgreen: {{PAGENAME}} gives the item +1 :Defend: and the :Enchantment: level increases +1. items.name: Royal Guard Cape
items.wikiFreeText: =Acquisition= When starting the game and using the button "Me" or typing /me, the player will find a short notice on the top of the message: :Exclamationmark: Please report to your captain in the castle chat. The password is ZOM ODO. ''(Note: The password is randomly generated for each player)'' Joining the linked castle chat and typing out those letters given in the password awards the player with a cape, that can be equipped next to all standard equipment. Earned: '''[[Royal Guard Cape]]'''. Check /inv to wear it. =Trivia= In earlier versions of the game the {{PAGENAME}} could be bought in the [[Shop|castle shop]] for 1 :Gold:, this got deactivated later on and now the item can only be acquired through [[Captain Arthur]].

items.name: Skull Crusher
items.description: The Skull Crusher features a mushroom shaped hammer head, which pans out before returning inwards on a central stalk. Attached to the mushroom lips are several inch long blades, wide for blunt, penetrating power when swung. About 5 feet long, the Skull Crusher invites users to drop their shield and bash others... both shields, and people.

items.name: Stick of Wisdom
items.description: A smart stick. Given out to those who helped create the encyclopedia of the land, or wiki, detailing all armors, weapons, events, craftables, resources, and parts... A laborous task. About the size of a staff, it's capped with an energizing green orb, giving the wielder extra stamina and seemingly luck. Thank you for helping!
items.freeText: It is a a special reward given to selected players for working on the chatwars wiki. It gives +2 :Stamina: stamina and +2 :Luck: luck.

items.name: Storm Cloak
items.description: Nicknamed the Storm Cloak due to an accident in a thunderstorm, the Storm Cloak is a favorite among assassins. Essentially a reinforced Royal Cape, it has a newly attached hood and metal weave to the inside. Capable of stopping some arrows and most dagger strikes, many people enjoy the added protection.
items.freeText: It was introduced in the [[Game updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].

items.name: Thundersoul Sword
items.freeText:
It was introduced with the [[Game_updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]]
 With a name like Thundersoul, you'd expect it to spark. A mithril-steel hybrid fades from dark blue to shining steel at the tip, and is etched with zig-zagging lines of imitation lightning outlined in white, before darkening as it fades to the steel. A bold 3 and a half feet long, it's nicknamed Thunder due to the crackling produced during forging.

It also increases the loot found at night in Forest. Torches can randomly break during quests.
